sentences.en: Adolescent suicide is rarely an impulsive reaction to immediate distress.
sentences.cn: 青少年自杀很少是由于突然发生不幸而作出的冲动反应。

sentences.en: All new fashion starts out as a reaction against existing convention.
sentences.cn: 所有新时尚都是从打破现有常规开始的。

sentences.en: He was disheartened by their hostile reaction.
sentences.cn: 他们的敌对反应让他打了退堂鼓。

sentences.en: Her three years of freedom seemed like a reaction against that childhood.
sentences.cn: 她那3年的自由仿佛是对孩童时代的反叛。

sentences.en: His reaction was as much of a rebuff as a physical recoil.
sentences.cn: 他的反应既是身体的退缩，也是一种断然的拒绝。

sentences.en: His reaction was to withdraw, to bury himself in work.
sentences.cn: 他的反应是抽身而退，埋头于工作。

sentences.en: I am merely citing his reaction as typical of British industry.
sentences.cn: 我仅以他为例来说明英国工业界的典型反应。

sentences.en: I think the reaction has been a little overheated.
sentences.cn: 我认为这一反应有些过激。

sentences.en: Let's have your gut reaction to the facts as we know them.
sentences.cn: 请告诉我们你对我们所了解的这些事实的本能反应。

sentences.en: My general reaction to this news might be summed up as "ho-hum"
sentences.cn: 我对这条消息的总体反应可以用“哼儿哈儿”来概括。

sentences.en: Our instinctive reaction when someone causes us pain is to strike back.
sentences.cn: 当被别人弄疼时我们本能的反应是反击。

sentences.en: Ozone is produced by the reaction between oxygen and ultra-violet light.
sentences.cn: 臭氧由氧气和紫外线发生反应而产生。

sentences.en: The ambassador was clearly disconcerted by the British reaction.
sentences.cn: 显然，英国的反应让这位大使很不安。

sentences.en: There has been a very mixed reaction to the decision.
sentences.cn: 对于这个决定的反应非常不一致。

sentences.en: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
sentences.cn: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时，他是什么反应？

sentences.en: Whenever recession strikes, a chain reaction is set into motion.
sentences.cn: 只要经济不景气，连锁反应就开始了。

words.tran_cn: 反动的；反动主义的；反对改革的
极端保守主义；反动思想
[物化] 再活化；再生；复能的情况；[核] 重激活
[化工] 反应器；[核] 反应堆；起反应的人
反应；影响；反抗；起反作用
使发生相互作用；使起化学反应

phrases.tran_cn: 不良反应；逆反应；有害反应
n. 反应原理，反作用原理；反酌原理

trans.tran_cn: 反应（能力），不良反应，化学反应，抗拒，反对
trans.tran_en: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said
